fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The problem here is with the target branch search in the Pull Requests page.

Basically, if you have more than 10 branches that match a pattern, the search will not bring up the branch you are looking for if the name of the branch *is* the pattern itself. 
Say you have 15 branches under the staging/* pattern, and one branch simply named staging - Staging will, in some cases, never show up in the target branch search in the PR page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 11 or more branches with a given pattern in its name 
 # It will not show up in the target branch search, and can never be searched for in the target branch search. This seems to happen only in specific cases though, and at the time of writing, we are unable to identify what causes the branch to not show up only for specific users.

h3. Expected Results
The branch will always show as the first result of the target branch search, as it matches the pattern completely

h3. Actual Results
The branch cannot be searched for in the target branch search.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Target branch search will not match specific branches if 10 or more branches hit the same pattern

fields.description:
Admins would like to have access audit trail of App Password to access repositories held under a workspace controlled by the admin.

Details include but not limited to:

1. Date/Time of usage of App Password
2. Details of App Password
fields.summary: App Password Audit Trail

fields.description:
Article [Hyperlink to source code in Bitbucket | Bitbucket Cloud | Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/hyperlink-to-source-code-in-bitbucket/] says forward slash in branch name in the {{commitish}} part is not supported.

 

Suggestion: Add support of forward slash using url-encoded branch name
fields.summary: Support forward slash in branch name in url

fields.description: Currently, we do not have any API endpoint that lists the installed apps on Workspace. Therefore, rasing this feature request to the server the same.
fields.summary: Add API endpoint to list Installed apps

fields.description: At this time, we do not have an API endpoint that lists the Oauth consumes on the Workspace. Therefore, creating this feature request to serve the same.
fields.summary: Add API endpoint to list Oauth consumers

fields.description:
At this time, Bitbucket Cloud uses a dynamic range of IPs to serve API requests to the Downloads section. This makes it impossible to whitelist specific set of IPs if the API request is made from a server behind a firewall.

For users, who make such API calls from servers with active firewall would benefit if we have static IPs instead, the same can be listed here: [What-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall/]
fields.summary: Require static AWS S3 IPs to serve Downloads section content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a new Pull request default reviewer creates a duplicate user. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to repositories settings under Pull request
 # At Default reviewers add a new user reviewer

h3. Expected Results
The user is added in the default reviewer

h3. Actual Results
The user is added with duplicate users.
 !Screenshot 2021-04-07 at 10.09.55 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page will remove the duplicate users from the UI
fields.summary: Adding a new Pull request default reviewer create a duplicate user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Very minor UI bug.  Newly added user renders double row on Default Reviewers pane.  See attached screenshot.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # visit repo settings
 # visit "Default Reviewers" pane
 # enter user name so that autocomplete finds the user
 # add user (use "enter" keyboard key or "Add" button, does not matter")
 # user renders double row

h3. Expected Results

Newly added user renders once.  As it is now, it confused the user (me!) into deleting the redundant row, which deleted both rows, making me re-enter the just-added user, realizing it's a UI bug rather than user error ("did I accidentally double-click the 'Add' button?")
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

User (me) realizes there's a UI bug and proceeds as if the user is not doubly-rendered.
fields.summary: adding a user on the default reviewers pane list new user twice

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Non-functional merge button when the target branch has branch permissions preventing users from merging

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure branch permissions on a branch, let's call this "Branch_A" this branch is set as the main branch.
# The branch permission is "Rewriting branch history is not allowed". 
# Navigate to a branch let's say "Branch_B" and "Branch_A" is set as the target branch.
# Click the "Merge" button

h3. Expected Results
# Message indicating why the branch cannot be merged with the target branch
# The merge button should be greyed out or unavailable for users to click

h3. Actual Results
# Users can click on the button. Nothing happens.
# Hovering over the Merge button indicates the user does not have permission. However, the message is delayed

h3. Workaround
* Merge changes via pull request
fields.summary: Non-functional merge button on the branch view

fields.description:
Customers use different flavors of IDEs, and they use Markdown also to write Documentation within the source code through these IDEs. Commonly, the Markdown syntax used within the IDE doesn't match the style seen by our customers on Bitbucket UI, causing additional efforts to adjust it according to Bitbucket guidelines. 

 

*Suggestion:*
 * Implement an additional markdown visualization within Bitbucket UI, following the [RFC-7763|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7763] Standards.
 * Allow users to choose between Bitbucket or RFC-7763 Markdown style.
 * Allow Code Tags that enforce the file to be displayed according to RFC-7763.
fields.summary: Enable RFC-7763 Option for Markdown in Bitbucket Cloud UI

fields.description:
Summary : 
Currently there is no direct way to retrieve the build minutes usage per user within a workspace. In a large workspace with many members, it is quite handy to know pipelines used per user.
fields.summary: Pipelines usage per user within a workspace

fields.description:
In a big team setup, Bitbucket Cloud UI operation like removing a group from repository notifies all the members in that group.

A feature to control such notifications at a single place only accessible by Admin would be a great plus.

Currently, each member needs to configure the notification individually
fields.summary: Allow Admins to control member notifications

fields.description: In "branching model" setting page, it's currently possible to define a "Development Branch" and a "Production Branch". However, I couldn't find any info in the "Variables & Secrets" documentation as of how to use them in our bitbucket-pipeline.yml. It would be useful to have them available as default variables. As of now, the only way get these branches using variables would be to duplicate them in the Repository variables, which is not ideal.
fields.summary: Branching model variables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a branch name has a special character, but still using UTF-8 format (example of the branch name: [Üser|https://bitbucket.org/YanaB-Atlassian/april5/branch/%C3%9Cser] or [mäin)|https://bitbucket.org/YanaB-Atlassian/april5/branch/m%C3%A4in], you will not be able to use Bitbucket UI to commit to that branch. You can clone the repository and commit changes locally, push to Bitbucket remote, but you will not be able to view those commits in Bitbucket UI as it will result in the error. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a repository and add either a main branch with names suggested above or create a new branch with a special character in it
 # go to source > select one of the branches with special character and try to make changes by either modifying a file or adding a new one and try to commit
 # You will be faced with one of the following error messages and checking Devtools will show you a 500 server error: 

!Screen Shot 2021-04-05 at 11.29.25 AM.png!
h3. Expected Results

To render commit content after it was pushed to Bitbucket remote repo and support special characters in the branch name as long as they are UTF-8 format
h3. Actual Results

See steps above, looking at the Devtools panel you will see a 500 server error when creating a commit using Bitbucket UI or attempting to view a commit on a branch with special character that was pushed to Bitbucket. 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No known workaround for now, except for creating a new branch without special characters and then deleting the old one that contains special characters
fields.summary: When branch name has a special character - you will not be able to commit to us or view commits

fields.description: Similar to the incident banner that is displayed while Bitbucket is going through an outage, it would be great to allow Bitbucket Administrators to set up notification banners for all their users under a specific workspace.
fields.summary: Allow Bitbucket administrators to create notification banners

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we create a new Pull request the mouse cursor moves to the description field after typing few characters in the Title field if the user starts typing before the PR is auto-filled completely.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Pull Request
 # Wait for the fields autofill 

h3. Expected Results

Disable the autofill, and let the customer defines the Pull Request title and Description 
h3. Actual Results

The customer observes that the cursor move to the description field after typing few characters in the Title field
h3. Workaround

Wait for the autofill to start typing.
fields.summary: Disable the autofill for Pull request title and description fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The cursor moves to the description field after typing few characters in the Title field if the user start typing before the PR is auto-filled completely 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Pull Request
 # Try to quickly type on the Pull Request title

h3. Expected Results

The focus should not move to the description button while the user is typing on the Title field
h3. Actual Results

The customer observes that the cursor move to the description field after typing few characters in the Title field
h3. Workaround

Customer should wait for PR to autofill and then only start typing the Title
fields.summary: When a pull request is created it does take some time to autofill PR Title
aws-ecs-deploy specify IMAGE_NAME instead of task definition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When reading PR notification emails in text, not HTML, @mentions are rendered as hashes and are unreadable.

I am reporting on behalf of Dan Kortschak (dan@kortschak.io)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a PR notifications email with @mention
 # read in text-only email client

h3. Expected Results

@mentions are displayed as handles, not hashes.
h3. Actual Results

!Screenshot from 2021-04-02 06-52-44.png!
h3. Workaround

Read email in a HTML-capable rich client.
fields.summary: @mentions in PR notification emails reads as hashes in text email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On a large pull request. Clicking on a comment in the activity section of a pull request does not focus on the comment. Instead, I'm on a file above the actual file with the comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a large pull request that contains outdated comments
# Navigate to the activities tab of the pull request 
# Click a comment, ExampleFile:489 [outdated], I'm directed to the file above the actual file. 

h3. Expected Results
* Redirected to the file with the comment, and the focus should be on the comment

h3. Actual Results
* Redirected to the file above the actual file with the comment. Focus is not on the comment

h3. Workaround
* Use the browser find function to locate the comment
* Scroll down to focus on the comment
fields.summary: Clicking on a comment of a large pull requests does focus on the comment

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket allows users to track files as LFS, mostly its recommended for binary file. 

However you are able to track any file extension as LFS and store them as LFS files. 

This creates a problem for user wanting to preview the file changes as we show it as "Preview unavailable" but we do provide an option to download the file locally for preview. This is what it looks like with markup or txt files currently: 

!Screen Shot 2021-04-02 at 9.23.14 AM.png!

*Improvement request:* to allow preview of those changes for non-binary files  that are tracked as LFS right in Bitbucket UI without having to download them locally for preview.
fields.summary: Support LFS preview in Bitbucket when the file is non-binary

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a user as a default reviewer to a repository, the user is added twice. When reloading the page, it looks fine, the user appears only once in the list.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the *Repository settings* page.
 # Select *Default reviewers* on the left panel.
 # Add a user to the Default reviewer

h3. Expected Results

When you add a user, the user should appear only once in the list.
h3. Actual Results

When you add a user, the user appears twice in the list. The issue goes away when you refresh the page.

!image-2021-04-02-17-53-39-135.png|width=491,height=152!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When adding a user as a default reviewer to a repository, the user appears twice in the list
Code blocks are not being properly rendered on nested lists

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Enabling pipelines on a newly created repository does not automatically create deployment environments.

Documentation reference:
https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/set-up-and-monitor-deployments/

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new repository
 # On the settings page, click on Pipeline settings and enable pipelines
 # On the same page, click on "deployments" and note the environments are empty

h3. Expected Results
It would have automatically created a Test, Staging, and Production deployment environment.
h3. Actual Results
No deployment environments are created.

h3. Workaround

Manually create the deployment environments either through the UI, or using our API.

API call example:
{code}
curl -X POST -u $username:$appPassword https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/$workspaceID/$repo_slug/environments/ -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '{"environment_type":{"name":"$EnvironmentType"},"name":"$NameOfTheEnvironment","rank":0}'
{code}
fields.summary: Enabling pipelines on a newly created repository does not automatically create deployment environments

fields.description: When you look at the list of repositories for the organization you can see the Description field for each which is very helpful in some cases.  The list of repositories for a project does not have this.
fields.summary: Show repository description on the project list

fields.description: Currently the only way to update the list of Jira issues when viewing them in the Bitbucket (cloud) site is to use the browser's refresh button (even when updating issues within the Bitbucket ui). There should be a button on the page to refresh the issue list.
fields.summary: The Jira Issues page should have an update or refresh button.

fields.description: If you select a jira issue in Bitbucket cloud and update it (such as changing the status) the issue is NOT updated in the dashboard so the dashboard continues to display the previous value. To get the dashboard to update you have to use the browser's refresh button to update the entire page. At the very least, the Jira Issue dashboard in Bitbucket needs a refresh button.
fields.summary: Updating Jira issues in bitbucket cloud does not update the dashboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a Workspace is upgraded to a Standard/Premium plan, where the username has been changed, the billing side gets the old username
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an account in Bitbucket Cloud (for example, username/WorkspaceID: test987
# Change the username only to test988
# Upgrade the Workspace to a Standard/Premium

h3. Expected Results
# Billing part inherits the new username (in this case test988)
h3. Actual Results

# The billing part inherits the old username (in this example test987)

h3. Workaround

To create a shared Workspace with the Workspace name, which we would like to see in the billing part
fields.summary: When a Workspace is upgraded to a Standard/Premium plan, the billing side gets the old username

fields.description: Please upgrade the dockerd service to v20.x.x for Bitbucket pipelines.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipelines: Upgrade Docker to version 20

fields.description:
Currently on Bitbucket, we only show the results of git log, and if there is any overridden history by future commits, we do not show it in Bitbucket.

This feature request is to add the ability to switch between the current {{git log}} shown in Bitbucket and {{git log --full-history -m}}
fields.summary: Add an option to switch between Git full history and git log

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

* configure branch permissions on master branch with "Reset requested changes when the source branch is modified" and "Prevent a merge with unresolved merge checks" checked in merge conditions
* check "Check that no changes are requested" in merge checks.
* Create a PR from a feature branch to master branch.
* Now, one of the reviewers clicked "Request changes"
* Then source branch is updated with a commit

*Expected Results:*

* "Request changes" done by reviewer in the above step is removed
* "No changes requested" merge check passed
* Users should be able to merge PR

*Actual:*

* "Request changes" done by reviewer in the above step is removed
* "No changes requested" merge check failed
* Users are not able to merge PR
fields.summary: "Reset requested changes when the source branch is modified" merge condition is not resetting the requested changes as expected

fields.description:
This feature request is to increase the number of branches displayed in the target branch display in Pull Requests > Target branches.

Currently we show 10 branches in the target branches dropdown. This is fairly small, mainly if you use branch patterns, as you would need to type a very specific branch name to get to the branch you are looking for.

A good number for this would be ~50 branches.
fields.summary: Increase number of branches displayed in target branch search

fields.description:
h3. Summary: 
Currently, it's not possible to sort the branches endpoint by last activity

h3. Expected results: 
It would be a useful feature, if the branches API endpoint could be queried by the branches' last activity date, this way end-users could see which of their branch hasn't been updated, hence those branches could be deleted.
fields.summary: Being able to sort /repositories/workspace/repository/refs/branches by last activity

fields.description:
Using the Code search functionality on Bitbucket Cloud, there's a limitation of file size results.
 Currently, according to our documentation: [https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/search-in-bitbucket-cloud/]
{quote}We index files smaller than *320 KB* – you won't see search results from larger files.
{quote}
Hence, if you search for a file that has a size of more than *320 KB*, it will not be shown on the search results.

*Feature request:*
 It would be very essential and useful for customers to be able to search files with large sizes of more than *320 KB*.

*Workaround:*
 Search code locally using code editors
fields.summary: Remove Code Search file size limitation

fields.description:
Currently, Webhooks has a timeout of 10 seconds.
 If a Webhooks request did not receive a response within 10 seconds, Webhooks will re-try the request up to 3 times.
{quote}If Bitbucket doesn’t receive the response to a request after 10 seconds, the request will timeout. To avoid timeouts, you can acknowledge receipt of the request by replying with an appropriate response before doing any expensive processing on your end.
{quote}
[https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/troubleshoot-webhooks/]

For those users who are using a 3rd party tool that uses monthly build/test allowance (e.g. Ghost inspector), the retries are consuming their monthly allowance.

*Feature request:*
 It would be really useful to be able to increase the 10 seconds timeout or allow users to configure the Webhooks retries on and off.
fields.summary: Configurable Webhooks 3 retries

fields.description:
Currently, on Bitbucket Cloud, all users will see the "View in VS Code" button in PRs.
 This feature request is to allow users to opt-out of this integration.
fields.summary: Opt out of VS code integration

fields.description:
Currently, there is a 24h window where the recovery email will arrive.
However, if the recovery process is initiated on Friday and the user doesn't access to their email address during that period, by the time they access it on Monday the request is already be expired.

To improve that experience, the ask for this feature request is to increase the expiration date to 72h or 120h to allow enough time to continue the recovery process.
fields.summary: Increase the expiration date of the 2SV recovery process

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Querying /projects/{project_key} does not return the repositories associated with that project

The documentation states that:
"project - Read your workspace's project settings and *read repositories contained within your workspace's projects*"
However, the response does not contain any information about the repositories themselves.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a project to your workspace
 # Run the projects API (e.g: curl -X GET -u $username:$appPassword https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/workspaces/#workspaceID/projects/$project_key)

h3. Expected Results
The repository names/information would be returned.
h3. Actual Results
The repository names/information are not returned.

h3. Workaround

The only way to see this information is through Bitbucket UI.
fields.summary: Querying /projects/{project_key} does not return the repositories associated with that project

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm the author of a popular plugin, which provides integration of JetBrains IDEs with Bitbucket:
[https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/13538-bitbucket-pull-requests]

I'm trying to add "Create Pull Request" feature into it, but I've faced with the issue that I cannot get the list of all possible (not only default) reviewers to show in the UI. 

I tried to use "workspaces/.../members" endpoint, but it only works for admin users. If it worked for non-admin users, it would be a solution too I think.
fields.summary: Getting list of possible PR reviewers through REST API

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm the author of a popular plugin, which provides integration of JetBrains IDEs with Bitbucket:
[https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/13538-bitbucket-pull-requests]

In particular the plugin supports filtering pull requests by an author, so we need some API endpoint to get all possible authors. Currently we do it through "https://api.bitbucket.org/internal/repositories/.../.../pr-authors", but it's not officially available (internal). It would be good to include it into "official" API, so we'll have a guarantee it won't stop working unexpectedly :)
fields.summary: Getting pull request authors through REST API

fields.description:
Hello,

I'm the author of a popular plugin, which provides integration of JetBrains IDEs with Bitbucket:
[https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/13538-bitbucket-pull-requests]

In particular we support commenting, where we show user mentions after a user types @, so we need some API endpoint to do it. Currently we use "https://api.bitbucket.org/internal/repositories/.../.../pr-authors" endpoint, but:
 # It's not officially available (internal)
 # I gives us only a limited list of users, but mention list contains much more users in the web interface.

We also tried to use ".../workspaces/.../members" endpoint, but it only works for admins. By the way a possible solution could be making ".../workspaces/.../members" working for non-admin users (if it's possible in terms of security).
fields.summary: Getting user mentions through REST API

fields.description:
h3. Summary: Currently it's not possible to change the order of the webcards in PR view (deployments)

 !image-2021-03-23-14-24-13-885.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results:
To allow changing the order of the cards
fields.summary: Allow to change the order of the webcards in PR view

fields.description:
IDEA: 
If we have a large PR, why not allowing reviewers to see all comments while showing side-by-side differences, that way it is easy even the PR is getting updated every time we can have one place to search and identify one particular comment.



This feature  enables optimizes a lot of time of reviewers, 

NOTE:  Please Avoid if it already in, and let me which version it is available
fields.summary: Allow Users to see all comments on a bitbucket Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket is returning a Bad Request 400 error when the file has more than 9000 lines. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to the Bitbucket UI
 # On the repository page, click on Add a File;
 # You can use a Random Text Generator, then copy-paste till 9000+ lines of text
 # Commit

h3. Expected Results

The code should commit without issues
h3. Actual Results

Bad Request 400

!image-2021-03-22-17-30-26-156.png|width=320,height=133!

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, you can commit changes using the command line.
fields.summary: Bad Request 400 while trying to commit code changes via GUI

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to add the ability to have Pipelines use the same bitbucket-pipelines.yml file from other repositories, for multiple different repositories.
This would allow users to reuse code and not need to re-create the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file in multiple different places.
fields.summary: Allow users to consume bitbucket-pipelines.yml files from multiple repositories

fields.description:
I was contemplating filing this under bugs, but I guess it belongs here more.

 

AWS ECR has the option for immutable tags:

[https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2019/07/amazon-ecr-now-supports-immutable-image-tags/]

 

These are useful for the added security. Bitbucket pipelines works fine on the first run and push to the ECR repository, but if you re-run the pipeline for any reason you will get the following error upon the second push:
{quote}Docker push error: tag invalid: The image tag 'tag' already exists in the 'name' repository and cannot be overwritten because the repository is immutable.
{quote}
 

Feature request: option to ignore the error if the image already exists.

(this might even be considered as the default behavior)
fields.summary: aws-ecr-push-image support for immutable tags (ignore if already exists)

fields.description:
This feature request is to set up notification routing to e-mail aliases so that aliases can receive notifications for a given account. 
Allowing notifications to be routed to other addresses will allow users to choose which e-mail will receive their notifications.
fields.summary: Routing e-mail notifications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 

When creating a new repo with the following endpoint:

[https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D#post]

it is not possible to set the main branch of a repo.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow users to set the main branch of a repo when they create a new repo via API.
fields.summary: Allow setting the main branch of a repo when creating a new repo via API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a repository is transferred, and a deployment environment exists with the "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment" restriction activated, admins will be unable to perform deployments to said environment.
An error message will state, when attempting to deploy to this environment as an admin, that you do not have access to this environment, regardless of your access level to this repo.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a deployment environment on a repository, and check "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment". Make sure you are an admin of this repository.
 # Transfer the repository where the deployment env was created between workspaces. Make sure to be an admin on the target repo for the transfer
 # Attempt to perform a deployment to the target environment
 # You will see an error message stating that you are not an admin.

h3. Expected Results
Admins should be allowed to deploy to the created environment.

h3. Actual Results

The below error message is thrown in Pipelines:
{noformat}
The Pipeline was paused because <user_who_triggered_the_build> tried to deploy, but only an admin can deploy to <target_environment>.
{noformat}

This error message will show up regardless of whether you are an admin or not.

h3. Workaround
Re-creating the deployment environment in the transferred repository should fix the issue.
fields.summary: If a repo was transferred, deployment permissions for admins won't work correctly

fields.description:
At the moment, we can copy pull request diff to any text editor without any additional characters like +, -, or line numbers in between the code.

However, when the diff code is copied via copy on select and middle-click paste from ubuntu, it is adding the additional characters like +, -, or line numbers in between the code.

The reason for this is the code is copied as rich-text rather than plain text.

Workaround:

* use CTRL+c and CTRL+v to copy-paste the diff in plain text format.
or 
* Use right-click copy-paste
fields.summary: Allow copying pull request diff using "copy on select and middle click paste" mechanism

fields.description:
h3. Summary: Currently there's no direct API endpoint which would list which repository has Pipelines enabled.

h3. Expected results: Have an API endpoint, which would list all the repositories which have Pipelines enabled.

h3. Current results:: Multiple API calls need to be done to achieve this:
First API call to list all repositories: https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D
Second API call on each repository to list if Pipelines is enabled:https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines/#get
fields.summary: An API endpoint to list all the repositories where Pipelines is enabled

fields.description:
Currently, we don't have an API endpoint that shows a list of user that was directly invited to the repositories. The one we have [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/workspaces/%7Bworkspace%7D/permissions/repositories/%7Brepo_slug%7D] list out all the user that has access to the repositories and does not distinguish which is invited or from groups access.

We do have this previously for API 1.0 and it'd be great to have this in API 2.0
fields.summary: API endpoint for user directly invite to repositories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When you create a branch, you can select "Other" in the branch type. 
Business case: Some pipelines fail when they don't include a prefix, so if a user creates one with the "other" prefix, it ends up breaking pipelines.
h3. Suggested Solution

Force having a prefix (bugfix/feature/hotfix) type selected before proceeding in creating a branch

h3. Workaround

You need to manually change the branch type to a specific type.
fields.summary: Force having a prefix (bugfix/feature/hotfix) type selected when creating a branch

fields.description:
At the moment, the workspace API endpoint doesn't provide a method to create a new workspace.

There are users that would like to be able to create a workspace via API.
fields.summary: Allow users to create a workspace via API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user tries to import a repo from workspace 1 to workspace 2, on import failure the admin of workspace 2 receives an email saying import was failed with the log details but when the user attempts to access the logs, the import log will not be accessible
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create 2 Bitbucket accounts with any workspace ids workspace1(workspace1@gmail.com) and workspace2(workspace2@gmail.com).
 * Ensure that the workspace2 is added as an admin on workspace1.
 * Now login to account with id workspace1 and begin importing any repository from any other workspace.
 * When this page appears, select workspace2 from the available workspaces(which means we are trying to import a repository into workspace2)
 * After the import fails with any reason, the user workspace2@gmail.com will receive and email similar to below.

{code:java}
We're sorry to inform you that we were unable to complete the remote Git import for https://bitbucket.org/sample/jpetstore/src/master/.

Viewing the import log might provide helpful information as to why the import failed.

If you need help or think the import should not have failed, please contact support. 
{code}
 * Clicking on the import log link from the received email throws out an error that you do not have access to view the import log and you must login to another account. After logging into Bitbucket account with email address 'workspace1@gmail.com' and clicking on the link again shows the import logs.

h3. Expected Results

1. User should be able to see the import log using the link received on the email.
h3. Actual Results

User is unable to view the logs using the link and is being prompted to login to another account.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{quote}Error: "You do not have permission to view this import log."
 To access this page, you may need to log in with another account. You can also return to the previous page or go back to your dashboard.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Not able to access Repository import log

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a pull request the checkbox for closing the branch when the PR merged is not clickable. The label next to the checkbox is clickable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Begin to create a pull request to open up the form
 # Click the checkbox and label on the form by the close branch after PR is merged option

h3. Expected Results

Clicking the checkbox, label, or text description for the option should select the option.
h3. Actual Results

The checkbox click results in no actions.

The label click results in the checkbox being clicked.
h3. Workaround

Click the label next to the checkbox
fields.summary: Clicking the Close Branch Checkbox While Creating a PR Sometimes Doesn't Work Correctly
"Next" URL response for repository variables and deployments endpoints are incorrect

fields.description:
Currently, the Jira Development panel only includes Bitbucket Pipelines' build status and Bamboo build status; It does not display the custom build status created with [API|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bcommit%7D/statuses/build].

This feature request is to provide the ability to display custom Build status in Jira's Development panel.
fields.summary: Display custom Build status in Jira's Development panel

fields.description:
Currently, the PR overview page doesn't show any difference between an unreviewed request, and one which has had changes requested: [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests?section=watching]

 

Showing whether the I have marked a given pull request with 'request changes' would help me know which PRs I've already reviewed, and am waiting for changes on, without needing to check each PR's page individually.  Showing that reviewers have marked my pull requests with 'request changes' also lets me know that others have finished the current round of review on that PR and are waiting on me, without needing to check each page individually.
fields.summary: Show 'request changes' mark/count on PR overview page

fields.description:
At the moment, we can copy pull request diff to any text editor without any additional characters like +, -, or line numbers in between the code. 

However, when the diff code is copied via copy on select and middle-click paste from ubuntu, it is adding the additional characters like +, -, or line numbers in between the code. 

The reason for this is the code is copied as rich-text rather than plain text. 

*Workaround:*

use CTRL+c and CTRL+v to copy-paste the diff in plain text format.
fields.summary: Allow copying pull request diff using "copy on select and middle click paste" mechanism

fields.description: It'd be nice to have the option to make variables for a custom pipeline required: [https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/pipeline-triggers/.|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/pipeline-triggers/]
fields.summary: Option to make custom pipeline variables required

fields.description:
Currently when creating a PR using Bitbucket API, we only allow the author to be set as the authenticated user who is using the endpoint, as described in our [API Pull request POST documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests#post]

However, for historic Pull requests this is not great, as other users have authored those PRs. 

Would be good to allow users to specify the pull request Author and the date for PR creation based on the original date. This is applicable especially for repositories that are being migrated from other platforms to Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: Allow users specify Pull request author other than authenticated user

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When you go to the Members page, you have the "Manage users" option that will redirect you to the "User groups" page. However, if the user has direct access to repositories, you won't be able to use this option to remove their access. 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a "remove" button to the Members page that allows admins to automatically delete them from everywhere. 
h3. Workaround

If the user you want to remove belongs to the workspace plan, you can remove them by following the next steps: 
 Access *Workspace settings* > *Users on plan* > Find the user you want to remove > Click on the *X* next to their name.
fields.summary: Add a "remove" button to the Members page

fields.description: It would be nice to have a filter in the list of pull requests which filters not yet approved pull requests. I would use it when searching through already merged PRs that are not yet approved, for later approval.
fields.summary: Filter pull requests which are not approved yet

fields.description:
Currently, there's no API 2.0 endpoint that will provide a user's last login date/time.

*Feature request:*
As an admin of a workspace, it would be useful to have an API 2.0 endpoint that will provide a user's last login date/time.
fields.summary: API to get a user's last logged in date/time

fields.description:
It would be helpful to show the admin, where an SSH key has been used, when they are trying to add a new SSH key, and they receive the warning message

"Someone has already added that SSH key."
 
I recently ran into an issue where I was receiving this message while trying to add a new ssh key. I double checked every repo/project/user and was unable to find the offending key, so I was forced to reissue a new one, and now I have no clue where the old key is being used. It would be helpful to just show the admin where the ssh is being used, so they can edit it from there.
fields.summary: Show where an SSH key has already been used

fields.description: Right now, there is functionality to set the default merge strategy for a repo in Bitbucket Cloud. But the ability to set a default strategy based on what target branch the PR is being merge to would allow teams better ability to manage their default merge strategies for master and develop branches.
fields.summary: Set default merge strategy based on Target Branch for a Repo

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to add Primary and Secondary reviewers to Pull requests, instead of just adding Default reviewers to pull requests.

The reason why it would be important to split PR reviewers into Primary and Secondary reviewers is that, in some cases, users would want to have a group of people who need to review the PR before it gets merged, without their review the PR won't be mergeable (Primary reviewers), and another reviewer group which is optional and won't block PR merges (Secondary reviewers).
fields.summary: Primary and Secondary reviewers for Pull Requests

fields.description:
Allow something similar to what [azure dev-ops|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/process/scheduled-triggers?view=azure-devops&tabs=yaml] has that schedules are automatically set from the pipeline yml file. 

For example this in :
{code:java}
schedules: 
  - cron: "0 21 * * *"
    displayName: string # friendly name given to a specific schedule  
    branches:
      include: 
        - develop
        - feature/*
        - bugfix/* 
      exclude:
        - feature/my_feature
    always: false{code}
Would build the pipelines that are named develop, feature/* (except for feature/my_feature), and bugfix/* every day at 9 p.m. only if there is new non-build commits on the branch.
fields.summary: Allow to set schedules from pipeline yml file

fields.description:
When creating a PR that has the same source and destination branches, the PR ID will be the same, but the description of the PR will be overwritten.
This causes confusion, as it basically allows users to change data of a PR that already exists and overwrite it with different data, while the author of the PR remains the same.

This feature request is to stop users from creating new PRs on top of the old ones, and instead, have the users update the existing Pull requests.
fields.summary: Stop users from creating PRs to the same source and destination branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Binary query parameter does not work for the /diff endpoint

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Doing an API call like: 
* https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/workspace/repo/diff/commit?q=binary=true

h3. Expected Results
* Provide a full diff on the binary files

h3. Actual Results
diff --git a/binaryfile b/binaryfile
index b8a333c..99a1c0c 100644
Binary files a/binaryfile  and b/binaryfile  differ


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Binary query parameter does not work for the /diff endpoint

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to add the ability to export all the pull requests data such as Author, Date& time, commits in a PR, etc to track code changes.

*Workaround:*

Use the below API to get the PR data.

*https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests
* https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/commits
fields.summary: Export pull request data to csv or excel file

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to add the ability to export all the pull requests data such as Author, Date& time, commits in a PR, etc to track code changes.

*Workaround:*

Use the below API to get the PR data.

*https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests
* https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/commits
fields.summary: Export pull request data to csv or excel file

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to add the ability to export all the pull requests data such as Author, Date& time, commits in a PR, etc to track code changes.

*Workaround:*

Use the below API to get the PR data.

*https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests
* https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D/commits
fields.summary: Export pull request data to csv or excel file

fields.description:
Request for a feature to help 

1. Choose an environment directly from the deployment dashboard and deploy to the same. 
2. Without having to configure the yml file. 

Business Requiment: This would help testers who are not developers to test on different environment without changing the yml file.
fields.summary: Select Deployment Environment from Dashboard
Change Audit log for user group invitation acceptance

fields.description:
Currently, if one of the admins of a workspace/repo deleted a repository, other admins won't be notified.

*Feature Request:*
 It would be very useful to be able to notify admins via email if a repository under a workspace was deleted.
fields.summary: Email notification on repository deletion for admins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently Bitbucket Cloud has a 10GB file size limit on a supported file size upload to Media API. 

If the user tries to upload to LFS a file that is larger than 10 GB, they would get an error : 
trace git-lfs: HTTP: 413 
HTTP/2.0 413 Request Entity Too Large
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # add a file to gitattributes to track as LFS, 
 # add a file larger than 10 GB to a repo 
 # try to push that LFS file up to Bitbucket remote repository

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
trace git-lfs: HTTP: 413 
HTTP/2.0 413 Request Entity Too Large
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Increase the limit for the supported LFS file size upload

fields.description:
Currently, if you execute a build for a merge commit, the BITBUCKET_PR_ID variable is not set, as it doesn't fulfill the requirement of being a PR build.

This feature request is to set up this value for branch builds as well, specifically on merge commits.
fields.summary: Set the value of the BITBUCKET_PR_ID environment variable when running a merge commit build.

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to change the "forked repository" to be the "original repository" and vice-versa, as we decided to use the "forked repository" as our main repository.

At the moment, it is only possible to ask the support team to detach the repositories and then fork the "forked repository", pushing the content that was in the "original repository" to it.
fields.summary: Ability to swap "forked repository" and "original repository" roles

fields.description:
Currently, the repository collaborators can't be automatically added to a pull request in case the aforementioned file is being changed.

This can be a useful feature for many users who wants to keep a check on specific files if they are part of pull request diff.
fields.summary: Automatically add reviewers to pull request if aforementioned file is being changed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking Merge with the "enter" keystroke on the merge pop up from the branches page causes an empty commit to being created

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to branches tab
 # Select a branch (click on it)
 # Click on the merge button (top right corner)
 # Click tab until the merge button and hit enter (with the keyboard)

h3. Expected Results
The branch would be merged creating a single commit
h3. Actual Results
The branch is merged creating a second (empty) commit.

h3. Workaround

Merge the branch by clicking the merge button with the mouse.
fields.summary: Clicking Merge with the "enter" keystroke on the merge pop up from the branches page causes an empty commit to be created

fields.description:
I don't know how does that thing is named but i found "branch-selector-toolbar" in the html class of the element and i mean that

!image-2021-03-10-16-21-35-866.png!

That thing contains a bunch of unsorted branches and quite not convenient navigation (if you don't want to use search by name feature)

My assumption is that it should group branches by prefixes (feature, bugfix, temp, etc..) and collapse them into alphabetically sorted submenus with alphabetically sorted items in them
fields.summary: Grouping and sorting branches in "Branch selector toolbar"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the workspace has no Pipelines app installed, the user unable to install Pipelines with the `Set up a pipeline` button on the BitbucketBuildCard, which located in the Repo's Source page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure Workspace has no Pipelines installed by navigating to Workspace's Installed App settings and remove `Pipelines` app
#* https://bitbucket.org/<WorkspaceID>/workspace/settings/addon-management
# Navigate to workspace's repository with no build
# Click `Set up a pipeline` button(Side bar)
 [^Screen Recording 2021-03-10 at 2.49.41 pm-1.mov] 

h3. Expected Results
Install Pipelines app and redirect users to Pipelines onboarding page

h3. Actual Results
It returns a blank page with no instruction to setup Pipelines build

h3. Workaround
Install the Pipelines app by clicking `Pipelines` on the left navigation bar.
fields.summary: Unable install Pipelines with the `Set up a pipeline` button on the BitbucketBuildCard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Scrolling the Activity section on the Pull Request review page freezes/stop working after selecting a file to be reviewed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click the "Activity" tab, scrolling of the right panel works.
# Click one of the links in the cards. Scrolling of the right panel still works.
# Click inside of the diff view so that you can scroll through the diffs. Scrolling inside of the diff view works.
# Click inside of the right panel (not one of the links on the cards), scrolling inside of the right panel does work, even if you navigate to the file view and click files. It only starts scrolling again when you click a link inside of the card of the activity view.

(i) Test done using Chrome (9 March latest version) with Windows 10 OS

h3. Expected Results

Activity section to keep available to be scrolled up and down regardless of where the last click was done.

h3. Actual Results

The activity section freezes/stops working.

h3. Workaround

# Reload the page
# Double click on one of the links inside of the cards in the activity section.
fields.summary: Scrolling the Activity section on the Pull Request review page freezes/stop working after selecting a file to be reviewed

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket's API is able to fetch specific commits using the following endpoint:
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commits/%7Brevision%7D

That said, it's not possible to specify a specific range for this request.

This feature request is to add the ability to specify a commit range to query on this API endpoint.
fields.summary: API to fetch commit range

fields.description:
h3. Changes

Please can you add a "Mark as complete" button to comments on PRs so that dev teams using Bitbucket can easily spot issues that have been addressed.

Can these comments please then be hidden (but still easily accessible with some indication on the line saying ("See hidden comments" - or something similar) once they have been marked as complete.

If you could also add a 'View comments' section to the PR page where all the comments can be viewed and ordered by completion status, this would also be very handy (acts sort of like a "has it been fixed" checklist before approving).
h3. Reasoning

We're seeing a recurring issue where PRs are cluttered with outdated comments that have been addressed (yes, we know some automatically are marked as "outdated" but this does not always work). This is not only overwhelming to anyone who views the PR (especially the poor soul who raised said PR), but it also obfuscates the code and therefore any issues it may have as it becomes *much* harder to read.

 

Happy to discuss this further is necessary. Thank you.
fields.summary: Add "Done" status to PR comments
Prevent scrolling beyond bottom in new pull request page when sidebar content is higher than viewport

fields.description:
Currently, once you visited a public repository and you're not part of that public repository or there's no action you've done in that repository, the *Recent repositories* will list the repository on your dashboard. - https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview

*Steps to replicate*:
# Go to this public repo (owned by Atlassian) https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/trigger-pipeline/src/master/
# Check your dashboard - https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/overview

*Feature request:*
It would best to not show any repositories in the dashboard's *Recent repositories* that are unrelated to the logged-in user.
fields.summary: Do not show other repos you're not part of on Recent repositories

fields.description:
If there's a file with many changes that's enough to trigger "Diff too large" warning, there's no way to leave comments.

When there are too many changes, you can't view the changes in `/pull-requests` page, whether you load all files at once or load them one by one. There are only two options left, open files diff or a wiki page to exclude the file.

If you choose open diff, you are taken to the `/diff` page. You can see the changes, but you cannot leave comments.

If you choose to go to the wiki page, it's not the information I need. If the file is included in the PR, why would I want to exclude it?

This seems to be a loophole in the business logic that large diffs are avoided from PRs, but it is creating intolerable inconvenience.
fields.summary: Cannot comment large diffs in PR

fields.description:
Comments added to a pull request and files in a pull request are included in the 'Activity' section of pull requests. 

The comments added to this section are truncated and display a preview of the comment. In order to see the entire comment users need to click on the link in order to see the entire comment.

Giving users the ability to expand the comment can help with efficiency and flexibility
fields.summary: Ability to expand comments in the 'Activity' section of a pull request
Manually running Pipelines builds in Safari throws "An unidentified error occurred. Please try again."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After logging out of Bitbucket Cloud, you are granted the option to sign in back using a different account through the "Log in to another account" button. However, if you input the correct credentials you are taken to the logout screen once again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Bitbucket Cloud
 # Log out
 # Click on "Log in to another account"
 # Type your credentials
 # You will be brought once again to the Log out page
h3. Expected Results
You will be redirected to the Bitbucket account overview page associated with the credentials

h3. Actual Results
You are brought to the log out page of the Bitbucket account associated with the credentials

h3. Workaround

There are two workarounds for this:
# You can completely log out using the log out button and re-enter the credentials
# If you click on "Log in to another account" and type your account credentials. Once you are redirected to the logout page, click once again in "Log in to another account" and select the account you want to log in, you will be correctly redirected to Bitbucket overview page.
fields.summary: Signing in using "Log in to another account" after logging out from Bitbucket Cloud leads to the logout screen once again

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Bitbucket Cloud maps the transition name as a status in the PR view rather than the status name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Transit an issue in a PR merge window

h3. Expected Results
The actual status (column 2) should be mapped as status, not column 1:
 !image-2021-03-08-13-33-25-175.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Transition name (column 1)  is mapped as status
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Transition name is mapped as status in Pull Requests

fields.description:
h3. Summary: Currently there's no way to find it out via UI or API, that the signed in user belongs to which group to a specific Workspace.

h3. Expected results:
To have an API endpoint where the user could query to which group he/she belongs to the associated Workspace
fields.summary: 2.0 API endpoint to retrieve what group the signed in user belongs to
Support for large (1000) pagelen values on /2.0/workspaces/<workspaceid>/members endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new pull request view, the file tree and diff tree order are different.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a PR where a single folder in a repository has multiple files changes
 # The PR diff-tree and file tree shows different orders

h3. Expected Results

The diff-tree and file tree should be the same
h3. Actual Results

The diff-tree and file tree are not in order
h3. Workaround

This behaviour doesn't impact any functionally and just impacts the user view. Therefore, no workarounds at this time. We have already taken this as an internal request.
fields.summary: Pull request file tree order and diff order are different

fields.description:
Currently, the code search feature only searches from a repository's main branch.

*Feature request:*
It would be very useful to search from different branches
fields.summary: Code Search to a different branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The following API endpoint is missing the "next" field:
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines/#get
The documentation states that it should return a "next" field with the next page of the request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # call the https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines/#get endpoint.
# Verify the response - You shouldn't see a "next" field, regardless of whether you have more than one page to display in Pipelines builds.

h3. Expected Results
The next field would show up with the next page

h3. Actual Results
The response is shown normally, but the next field is missing.

h3. Workaround
You can call this endpoint like this:
{code}
curl -X GET -u <username>:<app_password> https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/<workspace>/<repository>/pipelines/?page=2
{code}
fields.summary: Missing "next" field in Pipeline Get API

fields.description:
For customers who wish to continue using Jenkins, Bamboo or other on-prem CI/CD, it is desirable to not open their private network to internet traffic required to let BBC send webhooks to their CI/CD engine.

Ask is for an alternate queuing mechanism like OpsGenie OEC, sending data to a queue that can then be polled by a central internal agent and then re-hydrate to a standard webhook it can send internally on network.

Existing considerations include webhook secrets, signing, or allow-listing -- but each still require opening firewall to some extent.
fields.summary: Support webhook alternate or proxy for on-prem CI/CD
